intro: Octoknema orientalis, commonly known as the oriental octoknema, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and pinnate leaves. It is often found in moist, tropical environments and can grow as a shrub or small tree. Its botanical features make it of interest in both horticulture and traditional medicine.
